channel.title: Oscar Wilde on un01s notes
channel.description: Recent content in Oscar Wilde on un01s notes

item.title: useless beauty
item.description: “nothing is really beautiful unless it is useless; everything useful is ugly for it expresses a need” ― Oscar Wilde, The Picture of Dorian Gray “The truth is rarely pure and never simple.” ― Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest Kokoro is a 1914 Japanese novel by Natsume Soseki(夏目 漱石). It is the final part of a triology starting with To the Spring Equinox and Beyong (1912) and followed by The Wayfarer (1912).
